reviews.text: My husband and I planned our very first trip to USA and Canada this past March. Even though it was very cold when we arrived, we were warmly welcomed and made comfortable by Joe and Carm at “Redwood Bed and Breakfast”. We absolutely loved the entire house…very clean…very close to the Niagara Falls. We stayed in the Vineyard room where we found the linens to be of fine quality and a great pleasure to sleep in. We cannot forget the multi-course gourmet breakfasts served, a new delight every morning. Carm helped us with the activities and suggested visiting a “Sugar Bush”, not too far, where we learned how the famous Canadian Maple Syrup is made. In addition to seeing the mammoth Falls with very large ice formations, this was also a great experience for us.
reviews.title: Wonderful hospitality!
Awful Experience! Never try to cancel!
reviews.text: We really thank Carm and Joe for their hospitable personalities. Wishing to come back to Redwood Bed and Breakfast in the near future.

Due to circumstances beyond our control, we had to cancel our reservation at this inn over Labor Day weekend. We informed the owners of this, and the asked us to pay one night's stay. We agreed! They unfortunately tried to charge our credit card, which had since expired. I received numerous threatening emails saying that they knew people in our area who would come find us and that they would bring a lawsuit against us. I paid the one night's stay with a current card within two weeks of the incident. However, I did not appreciate the threats, nor did I ever receive an apology.
reviews.title: Saved our trip!!

reviews.text: Not all people try to take advantage, and the allusions to such was uncalled for. Horrible experience, and I would never stay with them when visiting Niagara Falls in the future. Try to be nicer people!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay
One of the best B&B's we have ever stayed in
reviews.text: We had a rather horrible experience at another B&B down the street, so when we were finally welcomed here and found a suite to our advantage, we were ecstatic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this guest house is truly beautiful. we had the 'la dolce vita' suite which was exceptional. great location just 10 minutes walk from the falls and all the attractions.
reviews.title: superb guest house

likes.liked: — clean. beautifully presented. perfect hosts. great breakfasts. access to sites and activities.

reviews.text: joe and carm are the perfect hosts and joe's breakfasts are truly amazing. we rarely had to eat much after one of these!
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: you are treated like royalty and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Feel Like Family at Redwood Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: please give this guest house a try, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Expect to find only the best at this B&B

likes.liked: — The customer service & the gorgeous rooms

reviews.text: Joe & Carm are terriffic hosts, the accomadation is really beautiful and kept to a very high standard. The rooms are stunning, and Joe's breakfast are very well presented. Excellent information given, a short walk away from the falls. Would go back again time after time. Thanks for a great stay.
reviews.title: My first Bed and Breakfast experience...perfection!

reviews.text: Okay, we’re spoiled now! My husband and I, and another couple, lodged at the Redwood for a three-night vacation in Niagara Falls. Everything about our stay was wonderful - cozy, warm atmosphere, comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms - and everything was spotless! The house is beautifully maintained and decorated with antique and art deco style furnishings. My favorite details - the intricately carved antique umbrella holder in the foyer (you have to see to believe), and the bathroom floors that are made of tiny mosaic tiles that look like sparkling opals.
reviews.title: Do you want the best? Redwood B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each morning the host cooked and served an awesome, multi-course gourmet breakfast with all the delicious orange juice and coffee we wanted. No lunch necessary!
reviews.title: You will never find a better one than this!

likes.liked: — Great Hosts and decoration. high quality of furniture and amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about Redwood are the kind and gracious hosts, Joe and Carm. Joe gave us excellent recommendations on places to dine, things to do, wineries to visit. We are looking forward to returning to the Redwood when next we visit the Falls.
reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I decided to take a long haul holiday to the other side of the globe and there we went to the famous Niagara Falls. Instead of staying at any regular hotel, where guests like us are usually regarded as "numbers", we decided to stay at the local Bed & Breakfast. The warm hospitality starts from the phone call reservation with Joe, which made us even more looking forward to the trip.
reviews.title: First class accommodations, breakfast, & most important, first class people

likes.liked: — The hosts, room, and within walking distance to all Falls attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been "warned" that staying with Italian family, the breakfast will be such a luxary treat. Indeed, Joe and Carm made us so welcome every single minute! When you arrive the frount door, you will know you feel like home again. Don't miss Joe's coffee the the best pastries he prepared every day! You might also feel that all the fruit are too sweet to be true!
reviews.title: A great B & B

likes.disliked: — Located up a hill from the main part of town

reviews.text: Joe and Carmella Rinaldis are the perfect host & hostess for your stay in Niagara Falls. They are warm, kind, considerate and caring people who have opened their home for others to enjoy.
reviews.title: 4 Stars! Simply the best find in Niagara Falls, ONT

likes.liked: — The clean and beautifully decorated rooms along with lavish breakfast served daily.

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: The front of their home is beautifully landscaped and decorated with plants and flowers. Inside, their home has beautiful hardwood floors throughout and they request that you remove your shoes at the door. Which was perfect for us because we are always in stocking or bare feet at home. We felt like we were at home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to follow Joe's reccommendations. Casa Mia and The Keg for dinner were both excellent choices which we enjoyed immensely.
reviews.title: Very Nice Experience

likes.liked: — All around nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Redwood Bed & Breakfast offers the Adventure Pass at a discount we reccommend you purchase it here. Better than spending your time standing in lines. You are close to everything, Maid of the Mist, Journey Behind the Falls, Skylon Tower, IMAX Theatre, Clifton Hill, Butterfly Conservatory and so much more.
reviews.title: Surprise Luxury

likes.disliked: — Ask Joe and Carm before you go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, plan a ride to Niagara-on-the-Lake for the Wet Jet Ride. What a blast! Great fun for all ages. We made our reservations for this trip online prior to our arrival. Be sure to stop at one of the many vineyards along the way and sample the wines.
reviews.title: We could not have asked for more!

likes.liked: — The hospitality, cleanliness, and character of the B&B and its operators
